metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19519 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In tcpdump 4.9.2, a stack-based buffer over-read exists in the print_prefix function of print-hncp.c via crafted packet data because of missing initialization.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19519` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
